<!here|@here> Just got off a call with Val, and there's a lot to share. Here are my notes, which include info on the semio session attendees <@U0914MEN7> as well as lots more info on the care assistant/bot. Please read through - 

TLDR on the chatbot - they want a dedicate and separate team to build an MVP for the June 22 board meeting. It is not currently defined, and they want us to get on a call with the care team (ET, DK, and Jackson) today to talk more details.

1. the agenda for the week of the 27th that Sheila put together that west is pushing back on (we agree, should not take that week to do full onboarding with every team)

2. A page from a presentation to show how they are thinking about match versus messaging, the two main buckets of the 2.0 experience they see. This shows how they see the care assistant fitting into the existing experience. It is not meant to show what 3.0 will entail.
we should see if we can get any of the artifacts from the “2.0” vs. “Care Everywhere” efforts they went for a few years ago when they hopped into mobile

<!here|@here> I created a Care Assistant budget spreadsheet and added my thoughts on scope / assumptions to the second tab. Numbers and scope thoughts have been vetted by Evans, but <@U0914MEN7> <@U0DCXC37U> and <@U06DFL7BP> I'd like to get your eyes on this in terms of:

1. Should the phases map to the same timeline as the Care 3.0 project given what we know we'll need to do design/tone/ux-wise?
2. Do the hours make sense for the same?
3. Are we comfy sending something low fidelity like this over given then quick turnaround request?
Also <@U0265G76F> maybe you can weigh in on the above as well.

we need to deep tech vet, and we need to consider where and why it should exist

Dont read this until tomorrow - but lets discuss the validity of the following assist strategy (briefed james and evans, but want collective confirmation):
 
Dear Val, We hear you and understand the situation and commitment that has been name - hence why you are looking only for a bid that allows bot on prod for June. However, if that is the case, I am afraid we are probably not the right partner. We would love to work on getting a bot like this to market, but overall our concerns are: (1) we feel it is a bit too risky with the tight timeline and having no access/experience with Care’s live envt, (2) its not how we approach work, straight to prod without the full strategy consideration… With that said and wanting to get you *something* - and also loving to look at this second project as a way to get more familiar with the Care stack to in turn make our 3.0 tech assessment more on-point - here is our bid for approaching it: (1) non-prod, but high fidelity and stack *considered* and (2) with upfront strategy and a set of core usecases and considered voice exercise. 

Further thinking:
DESIGN/STRAT
+ Begin engagement with a kickoff of 2 weeks of determining the bots “reason for being” - what value does it add in the current live product - where/why/how for whom
+ Then starting to consider the bot’s “voice” as a extension of care’s brand, authority trusted source, and consumer equity builder (2 more weeks)
+ Simultaneously to voice definition, begin considering the UX and current visual skin of the bot experience integration (same 2 weeks as ^)
+ Finish out the rest of the 8-10 weeks with strat/copy working on scenarios, voice, etc (though only a few will make it into proto, this will provide a more fleshed landscape for the potential of the on-prod build)
TECH
+ As described (though alot of grey still without stack knowledge and without full scope of scenarios) we would see this on-prod external in about 6 months-ish; beginning with 2-3 months off-prod, while simultaenously investigating envt and producing migration spec
+ Migration spec would likely include tech definition, multi-platform prototypes (assumed using twilio, a web interface, and some modified version of iOS/android), and an API definition for care to implement against internally 
+ Two lines of work here: 
(1) is likely more allocation of the PP-TD to further investigate the complexity of the care system, (beyond 3.0 research, to consider more thoughtfully the manner in which the bot would integrate) - working towards definition for the migration spec
(2) is a platform specialist who will research the assumed manifestations listed ^^ and advising the design team through their collect phase - then adding supporting resources to start in week 3-4 (through remaining 8-10 weeks) on building out all the decided prototypes on UCS envt, documenting along the way for later migration team

For Charles/Abby: i see this as a smaller creative project - collect/concept the reason for being with 50% strat, 50% UX, and 50% copywriter (2-3weeks max), transitioning to 10% strat, 10% UX and 100% copywriter (whole rest of the project), from a tech standpoint, we have someone looking at the complexity of the care system at 10% over the length of the project (prob 3.0 PP-TD) and then a supporting tech lead starting at 50% in first 2 weeks to investigate bot platforms and advise on strat, then moving to 2x100% (1 mobile, 1 web) while the copywriter goes off to do their thing, through end of project… 50% producer, minimal executive oversight, minimal HofP hours (its the same PP meeting)
